episode_event_ch0128_10_mitsuru/4001_100:
Great work, Gardevoir! I’m happy we trained
well today!
We’ll definitely win the next competition.

All that’s left is to figure out what to do about
our team. I think we should consider our strongest
moves’ balance...

Or...maybe teaming up with a Trainer who has
the same partner Pokémon could help.

Someone with the same partner Pokémon... Oh, of
course! I know just the person! If we team up with
them, we’re bound to win!
episode_event_ch0128_10_mitsuru/4002_100: Hello there, Wally. What’s the matter?
Um... W-would you join my team?

I thought up a great battle strategy we could try
that uses two Gardevoir!
Yes! He’s my new partner Pokémon!
If we work together, I’m sure we can win!
I’m sorry, but I have to decline.
Sorry if this comes off the wrong way...

but right now, I don’t feel enough of a shine from
the two of you.

When you understand what that is, come back
to me.

I lack something... I bet she’s talking about my
strength...

I have to get stronger—strong enough to gain
Diantha’s approval!
episode_event_ch0128_10_mitsuru/6001_100: Pokémon gave me my strength and courage.
That’s why I want to win—for my Pokémon’s sake!

I won’t lose to you either,
[Name:PlayerNickname ]!
episode_event_ch0128_10_mitsuru/4003_100:
What’s up with that guy and his Gardevoir?!
They’re so strong!
How’s it going? You keeping up with your studies?
What’s wrong? You don’t look too happy.

Get that knowledge of yours ready, and show me
what you got!
I admit defeat... Thank you for battling me.

I guess we need stronger moves. Or maybe we
should work on our speed instead...
Do you know why you lost?
It’s because I’m not strong enough.
You really don’t get it, do you.

You’re too worked up. You don’t need more
training—you need to get some rest.

Come and join me! Let’s go grab some nice grub
and have a bit of fun with Gardevoir—
I don’t have time to rest!
episode_event_ch0128_10_mitsuru/4004_100: I can’t be like this. I need to get stronger...
There’s no way I can win as I am now...
Hey, Gardevoir, what can I do to get stronger?
episode_event_ch0128_10_mitsuru/4005_100: Gardevoir, where did you go?!
Is it because I’m weak?
Do you not like battling with me anymore?
Is that...Noland?
Is he teaching them how to battle?

We don’t have much time until the competition.
He doesn’t have time to—
OK then, who’s my next opponent?
Me! Me!
It’s my turn!

No need to be so hasty. I’ll battle each and every
one of ya!
Hey, you there! You’re up next!
M-me? B-but this is my first time battling...
Hey, hey! Get a move on!
O-OK!
That’s good for your first try! You battled well!

Even though I lost, I still had a blast! I didn’t
realize Pokémon battles could be so much fun!
See, you get it!

If you’re already thinking like that, then you’re a
great sync pair!

Thank you! I’ll try to get stronger with my
partner Pokémon!
Although he lost the battle...he looks so happy...
It’s all coming back to me...
I was once like him...
And it was so much fun.
But now, all I think about is winning or losing...

And I’m not enjoying Pokémon battles like I
used to...

Now that I think about it, when was the last time I
had fun with Gardevoir?
I should apologize...
I was horrible to Gardevoir!
episode_event_ch0128_10_mitsuru/4006_100: Whoa!
I’m sorry!
Why are you in such a hurry?
Diantha, have you seen my Gardevoir?
Did something happen?
My Gardevoir disappeared.
I think it’s because I wasn’t considerate enough...

I ignored the bond we share—I only cared
about winning. I’m such a terrible partner...
When it comes to sync pairs...

both the Trainer and Pokémon need to work
together, hand in hand.

When I met you the other day, you weren’t seeing
your Gardevoir properly.
You’re right...
That’s why Gardevoir disappeared.
What are you going to do about the competition?
I won’t be joining.
I need to apologize to Gardevoir...

Then, I want to do what Gardevoir wants to do—
and I want to do it together!

Because...building a friendship with your Pokémon
isn’t just about battling all the time.

If that’s how you feel, you should join
the competition.

You want to do what Gardevoir wants to
do, right?
Your partner seems eager to battle.
Gardevoir!
I’m so sorry, Gardevoir!
I wasn’t thinking enough about your feelings...
Gardevoir, will you forgive me?
Thank you!
I’m glad you worked things out.
Yes!
We’ll join the competition, Diantha.

This will be my first time joining a competition
with Gardevoir, and I want to enjoy every part
of it.
So, please let me ask you again.
Would you join our team?
I’m sorry, but I can’t.
Because if we’re on the same team...
I won’t be able to battle you!

I feel such a strong, shining spirit coming from the
two of you right now.
And I want you to show that to me!
Diantha!

Understood! We’ll show you just how strong
we are!

We’re gonna make this competition the best one
yet! And we’re gonna have fun while we do it!
episode_event_ch0128_10_mitsuru/4007_110:
On the day of the competition, Wally’s team made
it to the finals.
episode_event_ch0128_10_mitsuru/4007_100: I knew you’d win your way up the ranks.
I can feel your strength, Diantha! It’s so thrilling!

Ooh, interesting! Now this is a match I can look
forward to!
Calem! Korrina! Let’s show them our shine!
Of course! I’m going all out!
Let’s give it all we’ve got!

Lucario’s fast, so they used all three Pokémon to
stop it in its tracks!

It’s all up to you, kid! The other team’s Pokémon
seem tired, too!

We’ll finish this off with Mega Evolution!
Let’s go, Gardevoir!
There’s no way I’ll let it end here...
episode_event_ch0128_10_mitsuru/4008_100: Congratulations on the win, Wally! I’m impressed!
Thank you for the great battle, too!

I can’t believe you had your attack planned out
from the moment we started that battle.
That was a wonderful plan—and great teamwork.

You were able to tear right through our
coordinated plan!

We had you on the ropes at the end, but even
then, both you and Gardevoir were smiling, Wally.

It shows how aligned your hearts were—and
proves just how much you enjoyed the battle!
Thanks to my team, I could battle until the end.

And I was able to remember how fun
battles are...
All thanks to you, Diantha and Noland!

You’re still so stiff and serious! You won the
battle. You can celebrate a little more!
And...erm... Diantha.

Could it be you want to talk about teaming
up again?

Actually, my Gardevoir seems to like the both of
you, so...

I’d like to extend the offer this time. Let’s join up
and form a team together!
Yes, of course!

First, we need to strengthen our bond as
a team.

Would you like to go to a café with both of our
Gardevoir?
That’d be fantastic! I bet it’ll be fun!
Gardevoir!
Let’s continue to enjoy a lot together!
